title: National Museum
description: Home to over 200,000 artifacts representing 5,000 years of Indian cultural heritage

title: Chhatrapati Shivaji Museum
description: Indo-Saracenic architecture housing extensive collection of Indian history

title: Indian Museum
description: The largest and oldest museum in India, founded in 1814

title: Salar Jung Museum
description: One of the three National Museums housing with largest one-man collection

title: Government Museum
description: Second oldest museum in India with rare bronze and stone sculptures

title: Albert Hall Museum
description: Oldest museum in Rajasthan showcasing royal heritage and artifacts

title: Calicut Art Gallery
description: Showcasing Kerala's rich artistic heritage and contemporary works

title: State Museum
description: Houses rare collections of ancient sculptures, coins, and manuscripts

title: Patna Museum
description: Notable for its collection of archaeological artifacts and Buddhist sculptures

title: State Archaeological Museum
description: Features prehistoric tools, temple sculptures, and tribal artifacts

title: Archaeological Museum
description: Preserves Portuguese colonial and pre-colonial artifacts of Goan history

title: Calico Museum of Textiles
description: World-renowned museum showcasing India's rich textile heritage
